snippet: Police officials struggle to understand the case of Brendan Cronin, an off-duty New York officer who opened fire on a car, hitting a stranger with six shots.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; officials struggle to understand case of off-duty New York Police Officer Brendan Cronin, who opened fire on car in Westchester County, NY, hitting Joseph Felice with six shots; Cronin says he has no memory of shooting, does not know men who were sitting in vehicle, and cannot explain how he ended up in area.
lead_paragraph: Police officials struggle to understand the case of Brendan Cronin, an off-duty New York officer who opened fire on a car, hitting a stranger with six shots.

headline.main: Two Cases of Violence, and a Question About the Severity of the Charges
headline.print_headline: Two Cases of Violence, and a Question About the Severity of the Charges
